Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory310.png
The shop door swings open, ushering in a flurry of chatter.
Female Customer
Miss Ayla? Look, it's Miss Ayla!
Male Customer
Ayla... Could it be the Ayla who topped the "Monthly King ART" popularity polls for ten months straight, the original creator and lead artist of "Beautiful Angel ENDLESS"?
Female Customer
Didn't you hear? There's a signing event with Miss Ayla today! I traveled all the way from the new conservation area just to see her in person!
You're quite the sensation, huh?
They're even calling you "Miss".
Ayla
Weird... I always thought my main audience was kids...
Ayla
Haha, maybe you should start calling me that too, Commandant?
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory748.jpg
Ayla
To "Red Comet Masha"...? Alright, signed. Make sure to let the ink dry.
Ayla
Hmm—finally signed the last one. It was more tiring than I expected.
Ayla gives her wrist a shake, closes her eyes, and lets out a stretch.
Some folks even tote along the whole comic collection.
Seems like folks are really digging your comics, huh?
Ayla
Haha, gotta admit, I was a bit surprised myself. Didn't realize I'd already published so many volumes.
Ayla
It's not that crazy. Some people just love the hype.
Ayla
Oh, by the way, I've got a special edition lined up for you, Commandant. Heard you're all hooked on the "Monthly King ART" series, right?
Definitely picking that up for some downtime reading.
This story feels a bit different from the usual, no?
Ayla
It's a special story I drew specifically for this event.
Ayla
Bringing back characters from past stories, the ones who, well, didn't make it, and those who vanished. All of them just hanging out, enjoying some carefree fun.
Ayla
A story that couldn't really happen, but I figured everyone secretly wished it could, so I made it a reality.
Ayla
Even though it started as pure fan service, I actually had a blast drawing it.
Ayla
It even got me thinking... maybe I shouldn't have been so quick to bump off a certain character or two...
With a storyteller like you, readers must be ecstatic.
Ayla
Not really, I started creating to please myself, you know?
Ayla
But once I realized my stuff needed to be shared, I figured why make people cry over a story when I can offer them a break from their real-world troubles, even if it's just for a little while.
Ayla
Beautiful Angel ENDLESS was clearly made for this very purpose.
Ayla
Some "professionals" might scoff, but who cares? I don't.
Me neither.
I really dig your comics.
Right, a rare chance...
Could you sign something special for me, Miss Ayla?
You pull out the prepared comic.
Ayla
This is...
A bit late, but...
That promise still stands, doesn't it?
Ayla
Looking back, it's definitely got its cringe moments...
Ayla
The storyboard's chaotic, the dialogue rough, and the characters are more sketches than anything, lacking that comic book feel...
Ayla
No wonder it wasn't widely loved.
But I've been a fan ever since.
Ayla
Haha, you got it.
Ayla
Consider this a special token of appreciation for my biggest fan.
She signs the comic, but with a completely different font than the one she used at the signing event.
Ayla
This special "Ayla" is just for the most special "you."
